    • Method Detail

      • andByField

        public SortFieldContext andByField(String field)
        Description copied from interface: SortAdditionalSortFieldContext
        Order elements by the value of a specific field.

        The default order is ascending.

        The sort field type will be determined automatically if possible, and an exception will be thrown if it is not possible. Automatically determining the type is impossible in particular if a custom field bridge is defined on the given field and if this bridge doesn't implement MetadataProvidingFieldBridge.

        Specified by:
        andByField in interface SortAdditionalSortFieldContext
        Parameters:
        field - The name of the index field to sort by
        See Also:
        SortContext.byField(String), The alternative for numeric fields with custom field bridges that don't implement {@link MetadataProvidingFieldBridge}.

      • andByField

        public SortFieldContext andByField(String field,
                                   SortField.Type sortFieldType)
        Description copied from interface: SortAdditionalSortFieldContext
        Order elements by value of a specific field, with the sort field type provided.

        The default order is ascending.

        Note: using this method is only required when sorting on a field on which a custom field bridge that doesn't implement MetadataProvidingFieldBridge is defined. Otherwise, one may simply use SortAdditionalSortFieldContext.andByField(String).

        Specified by:
        andByField in interface SortAdditionalSortFieldContext
        Parameters:
        field - The name of the index field to sort by
        sortFieldType - The sort field type

      • andByScore

        public SortScoreContext andByScore()
        Description copied from interface: SortAdditionalSortFieldContext
        Order elements by their relevance score.

        The default order is descending, i.e. higher scores come first.

        Specified by:
        andByScore in interface SortAdditionalSortFieldContext
        See Also:
        SortContext.byScore()

      • andByIndexOrder

        public SortOrderTermination andByIndexOrder()
        Description copied from interface: SortAdditionalSortFieldContext
        Order elements by their internal index order.
        Specified by:
        andByIndexOrder in interface SortAdditionalSortFieldContext
        See Also:
        SortContext.byIndexOrder()

      • andByDistance

        public SortDistanceNoFieldContext andByDistance()
        Description copied from interface: SortAdditionalSortFieldContext
        Order elements by distance.

        The default order is ascending, i.e. shorter distances come first.

        The distance is computed between the value of a field carrying coordinates (to be provided in the next context) and reference coordinates.

        Specified by:
        andByDistance in interface SortAdditionalSortFieldContext
        See Also:
        SortContext.byDistance()

      • andByNative

        public SortNativeContext andByNative(SortField sortField)
        Description copied from interface: SortAdditionalSortFieldContext
        Order element using the native backend API for Lucene.

        The sort order (ascending/descending) is defined in sortField

        Specified by:
        andByNative in interface SortAdditionalSortFieldContext
        Parameters:
        sortField - The sort field to be added to the sort list.
        See Also:
        SortContext.byNative(SortField)

      • andByNative

        public SortNativeContext andByNative(String sortField,
                                     String nativeDescription)
        Description copied from interface: SortAdditionalSortFieldContext
        Order element using the native backend API for Elasticsearch.
        Specified by:
        andByNative in interface SortAdditionalSortFieldContext
        Parameters:
        sortField - The name of the index field to sort by
        nativeDescription - The sort field description, as valid JSON. This may be a simple quoted string (e.g. "'asc'") or a JSON map (e.g. "{'key': 'value'}"). See Elasticsearch's documentation for information about the exact syntax.
        See Also:
        SortContext.byNative(String, String)
